randomartassignment.expression

Class ExpressionGeneratorParallel

  • java.lang.Object
    • randomartassignment.expression.ExpressionGeneratorParallel

  • public class ExpressionGeneratorParallel
extends java.lang.Object
    ExpressionGeneratorParallel is essentially a wrapper around ExpressionParallel in that it represents a whole expression along with associated methods that help create it and evaluate it. It has been designed to work in a parallel fashion. In order to use any subclasses of ExpressionParallel, make sure to adjust this class.
    Version:
    1.0 20 July 2012
    Author:
    Amndeep Singh Mann

    • Field Detail

      • root

        private ExpressionParallel root
        The root expression upon which all of the other expressions are built.

      • RANDOM

        static final java.util.Random RANDOM
        This object returns random values that help determine in what order expressions are created. Please use it when randomness is required so as to maintain unique but reproducible creations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExpressionGeneratorParallel

        public ExpressionGeneratorParallel(int expressionDepth)
        A constructor that accepts a value for the maximum depth of the expression - keep in mind that it does not necessarily always reach it.
        Parameters:
        expressionDepth - An integer that represents the maximum possible depth of the expression, it must be between 0 and less than the maximum amount of calls to the stack that are allowed by the Java implementation.

      • ExpressionGeneratorParallel

        public ExpressionGeneratorParallel(ExpressionParallel ex)
        A constructor that accepts a pre-made expression.
        Parameters:
        ex - A fully filled ExpressionParallel tree.

    • Method Detail

      • grayscaleTest

        public static void grayscaleTest()
        A test expression that has a predetermined output (shown in "Grayscale check.png").

      • createExpression

        private ExpressionParallel createExpression(int depth)
        Generates a full expression.
        Parameters:
        depth - An integer that is the maximum possible depth that this expression will go, though it may not necessarily reach it.
        Returns:
        A full expression with subexpressions that have their own subexpressions and so on, with all nodes ending with one or more variables.

      • evaluateExpression

        public double evaluateExpression(double setX,
                        double setY)
        Evaluates the root, using these arguments as the substitutes for the variables in the root.
        Parameters:
        setX - A value between [-1.0, 1.0] that represents a pixel's x-position.
        setY - A value between [-1.0, 1.0] that represents a pixel's y-position.
        Returns:
        A double between [-1.0, 1.0].

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A representation of the root that is mathematically correct - i.e. using parenthesis to denote precedence and order of operation use and to denote the location of arguments for functions.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string that represents the root.
